body_html:
Fair enough, I'll add some of my findings here though for others looking at least:

One question I had quickly after training is how to save my work to a single "baked" model with the graph, weights, and biases in a single file. I was assuming that I could do that with the existing graph easily, but it looks like you currently need to create an alternate graph to do that. See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34343259/is-there-an-example-on-how-to-generate-protobuf-files-holding-trained-tensorflow/34343517#34343517

body:
Fair enough, I'll add some of my findings here though for others looking at least:

One question I had quickly after training is how to save my work to a single "baked" model with the graph, weights, and biases in a single file.  I was assuming that I could do that with the existing graph easily, but it looks like you currently need to create an alternate graph to do that. See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34343259/is-there-an-example-on-how-to-generate-protobuf-files-holding-trained-tensorflow/34343517#34343517
